Today, Memorial Hermann Health System officially launched Epic with our first wave of users. Thanks to the efforts of over 2,000 team members and our partners at Epic, we're transforming the experience across our medical group, affiliated practices, clinics, pharmacies, and employer solutions with a transformed experience that will help improve the care we deliver to our patients.

This extensive, two-year journey has touched nearly every part of our organization, marking one of the most significant transformations in my career. I'm eager to see the positive changes as we settle into operational efficiency and our patients engage with new digital experiences.

Congratulations to everyone involved, especially Amanda Hammel and Rick Lyman, DSL, MBA for their pivotal roles in guiding this effort. #EPICTransition #DigitalInnovation #PatientExperience
column11: Senior Vice President And Chief Information Officer Digital, Data And Analytics

column2:
Welcome Wellhub!

One of the best things here is thinking long term. This has allowed us to make some bold moves in the past, like:
- Only focusing on B2B (working with Clients to offer Wellhub as a benefit to employees)
- Upgrading all subscribers to a new micro-services tech platform (that engages more people with wellbeing and increases check-ins)
- Investing in digital partnerships to complement the amazing offering we have with in person fitness and wellness partners!

And now, changing the name of the entire business to Wellhub. An obvious decision considering a multi-year perspective.

Got my welcome to Wellhub kit today!

It's day 1.

I'm feeling fresh to takle our mission to make every company a wellness company and help employees check-in with their wellbeing everyday.

#justthebeginning

It was lovely to meet so many great colleagues in person and I was truly impressed to see the passion and commitment to meet everyday consumer needs across our diverse markets.

I also really enjoyed having the opportunity to tour our state-of-the-art Shopper Science Lab, which harnesses industry-leading technology and unlocks deep consumer and shopper insights to help us bring our latest innovations to life in store and transform the way shoppers interact with our brands. An excellent panel discussion about #DigitalTransformation as a #Strategy for #Sustainability at Digital Transformation Week Conference. Thanks to Subject Matter Experts and digital transformation leaders Saumya Vardhan, Kamala Manju Kesavan, and Stephen Ma in sharing their insights and experiences.
The main focus of this panel was on developing #Human-Centered Design #TechnologyEcosystem to shift from compliance ( meeting minimum standards) to  regeo( capacity building and living whole system thinking), and shift from #TechnologicalSustainability to #EcologicalSustainability to accomplish #ESG(enviromental, social, and governance) goals through digital transformation. Likewise, our panel emphasized the financial benefits in all organizations.
Our panel outcome: Creating a digital Technology Ecosystem that embraces Sustainability and regenerative solutions to build a better future for the current residents of our #planet 🌍, for our next #generations, and all #beings. 👫🌈☁️🌎🪐🌴🌲🪸🐬🦍🐢🕷️🐍🦒🕊️🦢
Special thanks to Rosie Fletcher for the invitation and for organizing this high-end event. I'm eagerly looking forward to the following chapters of the digital transformation arena and the opportunities they will bring to meet and learn from all of you.
Yahoo Ulta Beauty International Society for Telemedicine & eHealth Sofia University Digital Transformation Week
#DigitalTransformationWeek
column23: Fantastic panel!  Great hearing insights from you!

column2: This article is written by Scott Ulrich, MBA, CHFP, CRCR, VP Finance at Houston Methodist Hospital, about our process of investing in innovation initiatives.

Putting together a RAG Solution is easy with the tools available. But why do 90% fail and fall into the POC Valley of Death
1) Data Completeness, Data Quality and Chunking Strategy
2) Add other metadata and structured data as needed for context
3) Embedding Storage for context passed to LLMs
4) LLM Hallucination - This is the only thing people talk about
5) Not considering multiple data dimensions needed for full context

Contact Alexander Stufflebeam, FSA, CERA Rajesh Iyer Pinaki Bhagat Ashvin Parmar and rest  of our team Capgemini Data and AI Capgemini Financial Services

Our Rigid Paper Container team met with global brand owners and industry leaders to discuss circularity in recycling during the two-day Sustainability in Packaging Asia forum in Singapore last week. We showcased a variety of our innovative, sustainable products, such as our popular EnviroCan® container.

Designed for recycling, EnviroCan offers customizable paper bottom solutions and sealing technology to advance and promote consumer recycling. If you missed us in Singapore, you can still meet to discuss EnviroCan and other innovative solutions here https://lnkd.in/ezkuWs43. Hope to see everyone again next year!

DI Squared was thrilled to have an active participation at the Qlik Connect Conference this year, where we joined our customers for an insightful panel discussion on "Modernizing Your Business and Moving to the Cloud." Our very own Trey Smith was honored to share the stage with industry leaders James Newsom Jr from Jacuzzi, and Ana Pinheiro from Takeda. Also participating in the panel discussion was Akshaya Aditya from Genentech, and the host Heather Gittings (Qlik). Together, they delved into effective cloud transformation strategies and shared their unique experiences on leveraging cloud technology to drive business innovation and efficiency.​
​
Thank you to Qlik for hosting such an impactful event and to all our partners and customers who continue to inspire us. We look forward to more collaborative opportunities and driving the future of business intelligence together!​
​
#QlikConnect #DISquared #QlikCloud #CloudTransformation #Qlik #BI #qlikpartnerambassador

Was awesome to learn from the brilliant Dr. Jennifer Goldman DO, MBA, FAAFP, CMIO of Memorial Healthcare System, on The Digital Patient podcast.

We went deep on:

→ Strategies used to eliminate 800,000+ daily clicks across the health system

→ How to implement Social Determinants of Health (SDoH) tools into the EHR

→ Leveraging technology to streamline primary care, including automating preventive care processes and documentation

→ How digital health leaders should think about balancing competing priorities between improving patient outcomes and addressing operational challenges (workforce shortages, financial losses)

… and much, much more!

Link to the episode in the comments below 👇

#digitalhealth #healthcareinnovation

Big news! Today is the launch of SCI Ventures, the first venture philanthropy fund focused on accelerating the development of innovative therapies for people living with paralysis – and Shepherd Center is part of it!

As a co-founder of SCI Ventures, we’re on a mission to spark innovation and bridge the gap between lab research and making discoveries available to help restore functions for those with spinal cord injury and ultimately cure paralysis.

At Shepherd Center, we’re honored to come together with Wings for Life - Spinal Cord Research Foundation, Spinal Research, Christopher & Dana Reeve Foundation, and Promobilia Foundation to support this single, first-of-its-kind, and truly game-changing investment vehicle. Through our combined network and knowledge, we plan to attract more capital to the SCI space by lowering the risk for additional investors from across the VC and healthcare industries. 

Through our combined network and knowledge, we hope to attract more capital, investment, and awareness to develop therapies that will help people begin again after spinal cord injury.

Read more about the launch: https://bit.ly/3VxEsxE

🏆 I am brimmed with pride that The AES Corporation’s strategic approach toward Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence was recognized with a 2024 CIO Award for IT Leadership and innovation.

The world's energy landscape is undergoing a transformation to address the world’s needs of cleaner and smarter solutions. Always in the forefront of innovation, at The AES Corporation we are convinced that Machine learning and AI will be a powerful game-changer, that will further boost renewable energy integration, smart grid management and predictive maintenance.

🌞At The AES Corporation, we leverage machine learning to predict renewable asset output, while also automating operations for a streamlined renewable energy service.

My sincere appreciation goes to David Orr, Alejandro Reyes, Angie Wyatt, Alberto Alejandro Tabellione, Pedro Mata, Erin Boyd and their teams, whose visionary approach and strive for excellence are instrumental in shaping the pioneering solutions, that enable us to continue accelerating the future of energy, together. 👏

Read more at: https://lnkd.in/eFJVi6Tj

#YesAES #GreatTeam #FutureOfEnergy

I am pleased to share an article published in the most recent Innovation Issue of the Indianapolis Business Journal that highlights AES Indiana's recent efforts to demonstrate how we can increase  grid capacity through innovative technologies.
 
The United States is experiencing a rapidly shifting energy landscape due to the rising use of electricity, including electric vehicles and big tech data centers, which highlight the need for energy production and delivery to keep pace with growing customer demand. At The AES Corporation, we’re piloting innovative projects, such as LineVision's Dynamic Line Ratings (DLR), to better understand how we can deliver more energy on the grid as safely and efficiently as possible.
 
You can read the full article where I share more about AES Indiana’s LineVision pilot project, initial findings, and key learnings so that we can get more value from our existing grid assets with improved information. This pilot project reinforces that innovation is a crucial component for a greener, safer, and more equitable energy future.
 
#AES #Innovation #SustainableEnergy

Day one of #BESummit24 has kicked off, and this year is all about pushing boundaries, fostering innovation, and driving the clean energy transition. Here are the highlights for Wednesday:

- Eric Toone’s Keynote Speech: Eric's speech will set the tone for the future of energy. His insights into sustainable innovation are sure to inspire and challenge us all.

- Role of AI in Energy: The convergence of artificial intelligence and energy is revolutionizing the sector. We'll explore AI applications that are enhancing efficiency and driving new possibilities.

- Deep Dive into the BE Approach: An in-depth exploration of our approach to solving the world’s energy challenges. This session will provide a comprehensive look at our strategies and initiatives, setting a clear path forward for sustainable energy solutions.

Wednesday's sessions are packed with knowledge and networking opportunities. View the Summit Hub to download the Summit app and get more resources: https://nt-z.ro/4ch4tYa

As temperatures soar during summer heatwaves, our power grids face unprecedented strain. At Highland, we’re working on Vehicle-to-Grid (V2G) programs that can provide crucial backup power to the grid, ensuring that essential services remain operational. As we navigate the challenges posed by extreme weather, embracing V2G technology is an innovative step forward. Let's drive towards a smarter, more resilient energy landscape, where our vehicles do more than just transport us; they empower us.

https://nyti.ms/3XDAG7r

#V2G #SmartGrid #EnergyManagement

What makes an innovative organisation? It's more than just actions, over words. It's in their willingness to take chances, in their courage to experiment, and in their constant state of curiosity. 

They see challenges as opportunities. Continuously improving, evolving and refusing to accept how they work today, as how they want to work tomorrow.

It's in their hunt for humility, an open arms approach to learning, the abolition of ego, and the warmth, respect and veracious hunger for the input of others.

Innovation cultures are forged from diverse and inclusive engagements involving unusual suspects. A melting pot of combustible people and materials that meet in sometimes bizarre and serendipitous ways to spark unexpected yet powerful reactions. It's a mindset, and it's in the DNA of the organisation, the particles and bonds, the synaptic connections, how they fuse and branch.

Innovative organisations are melting pots of divergent minds. They celebrate the value of difference. A little bit of the past, a pinch of the present, and a heavy hit of the future. Drucker was right when he said culture eats strategy for breakfast Paul. One could argue it eats it for lunch and dinner too.

Our most recent R&D town hall meeting this quarter was a fantastic opportunity to celebrate our collective achievements and welcome new faces to the team.

The highlight was officially welcoming the Ventiv team to the Riskonnect family. Although we’ve had many connects over the past month, this was the first quarterly meeting with those joining our team from Ventiv. With team members now spanning five geographies, our combined expertise and technology strength promise an exciting future with great potential to innovate and redefine risk management as we integrate into a single platform to offer ‘Risk under one roof’ to customers worldwide.  Welcome Michael Hamann, Gaurav Tandon, Poornima Raj, Narayanan Neelakantan, Vishal Yadav, SHARAD G. and the entire Ventiv R&D team!

Our journey of product innovation is also something we are proud of as a team. Work has already begun on developing new ways to address IT Risk Management. That’s not all… The AI Innovation Lab has been busy delivering three proof-of-concept projects, two of which were showcased at the RIMS (Risk and Insurance Management Society, Inc.)/Risk World conference! These advancements are just part of our journey to continue to offer AI’s offerings in the areas of Embedded Decision Support, Enhanced Workflow and Efficiency, and Practical Innovation.  Thank you Kathryn Carlson for covering our Product vision at the town hall!

We also congratulated colleagues who earned promotions through their hard work and commitment. Our accomplishments are a testament to what we can achieve together, and a result of our team philosophy with "spark" and "community" as key reminders - while we continue to innovate, collaborate, and push the boundaries of what’s possible. 

Riskonnect, Inc., Riskonnect Services Pvt, Ltd. (India)
#TeamSuccess #Innovation #AI #RiskManagement #RiskUnderOneRoof

1. Sharing Amazon's journey for #CustomerExperience #Innovation that started 30 years ago and has led to services such as #AmazonPersonalize. Peeling back on leveraging our #CultureOfInnovation to help retailers use #GenAI + #Personalization to serve consumers with more compelling, personalized experiences, at scale. 

2. Learning from customers such as Andrea Cappi at Valentino, Loretta Franks at Kellanova and Deliveroo about their brand's unique differentiation in retail, cpg and last-mile.

Thanks to our AWS team for the partnership - Heidi Bonjean, Lauran Wilcox, Duncan Stewart, Mark Westney, Puneet Goenka, Gaia Ginevra, Marco Kormann Rodrigues, Stijn Demeersseman, Francesca Vizzi, Giulia Rossi and Kevin Kennel!
